title: Ticket #513: "Unable to set file ACL" error in NMI, when running Condor tests.
description:
The following types of errors can be seen in NMI in the starter logs: 

  ...
  5/25 23:25:18 perm::set_acls(C:\Condor\execute\dir_1868\userdir\externals\build_external): Unable to set file ACL(err=6).
  5/25 23:25:18 perm::set_acls(C:\Condor\execute\dir_1868\userdir\externals\bundles): Unable to set file ACL(err=6).
  ...

It would be nice to (a) know why they are occurring, and (b) fix it.
remarks: problem was cygwin denying condor delete access to files in the execute directory. Fixed by adding the condor_rmdir.exe command.
creator: burnett
